main event: Two separate UFO sightings reported in Macon, Georgia on May 20, 1964.
interesting points: The first sighting was reported by a Lt. Hoscore of the Bibb County Sheriff's Department, who saw a bright object at an estimated 30,000 feet altitude.
The second sighting was reported by AIC Lawrence J. Seaick of the 7th Logistical Squadron at Robins Air Force Base, who saw an object at 20,000 feet or higher traveling from north to south.
The objects were reported in the same general area and at the same time (0130Z).
The Robbins Air Force Base command post indicated the sightings were likely caused by a flight of four KC-135 tanker aircraft that took off at 2002 hours at 15-second intervals.
The report concludes that the sightings were possibly caused by the KC-135 aircraft, but the time of the sightings was considered to be in error.
sighted object: bright light at 30,000 feet, object at 20,000 feet or higher
witnesses: Lt. Hoscore of Bibb County Sheriff's Department, AIC Lawrence J. Seaick of Robins Air Force Base
